summary: The 'Jobs and Opportunities for Medicaid Act' seeks to amend Title XIX of the Social Security Act to introduce work requirements for able-bodied adults enrolled in state Medicaid programs.  Starting January 1, 2026, the bill would deny medical assistance to able-bodied adults who do not meet a 20-hour-per-week work or volunteer requirement. Exceptions are provided for individuals based on age, medical condition or caregiving responsibilities.
